intro: Hieracium transiens subsp. phaedrochlorum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a distinctive yellowish-green coloration, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its pale yellow flowers and specific geographic distribution.
